overview: 1 Kings begins with Solomon's glorious reign and the temple's construction, then traces the kingdom's division and decline. It shows how unfaithfulness to God leads to national disaster.

verses.text: Give your servant therefore an understanding mind to govern your people, that I may discern between good and evil, for who is able to govern this your great people?
But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the highest heaven cannot contain you; how much less this house that I have built!
And Elijah came near to all the people and said, 'How long will you go limping between two different opinions? If the LORD is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him.'

passages.title: Solomon's Wisdom
passages.summary: Solomon settles a dispute between two mothers, revealing the real mother through his famous judgment. His wisdom becomes legendary.

passages.title: The Temple Dedication
passages.summary: Solomon dedicates the magnificent temple with prayer and sacrifice. God's glory fills the temple, signifying His presence among His people.

passages.title: Elijah on Mount Carmel
passages.summary: Elijah challenges 450 prophets of Baal to a contest. God answers with fire from heaven, proving He alone is God.

facts.text: Solomon's temple took seven years to build and was one of the ancient world's most magnificent structures, covered in gold.
The kingdom split into Israel (north) and Judah (south) after Solomon's death, due to his son Rehoboam's harsh policies.
Elijah is one of only two people in the Bible who didn't die but were taken directly to heaven (the other is Enoch).
Despite his wisdom, Solomon's many foreign wives led his heart away from God, resulting in the kingdom's division.

figures.name: Solomon
figures.description: David's son, known for unparalleled wisdom and building the temple. His later unfaithfulness to God led to the kingdom's division.

figures.name: Elijah
figures.description: One of Israel's greatest prophets who confronted Baal worship and called Israel back to the LORD through dramatic miracles.

figures.name: Ahab
figures.description: An evil king of Israel who, with his wife Jezebel, promoted Baal worship and opposed Elijah.

figures.name: Jezebel
figures.description: Ahab's Phoenician wife who imported Baal worship into Israel and persecuted God's prophets. Her name became synonymous with wickedness.

videos.title: 1 Kings Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores Solomon's reign, the divided kingdom, and the prophet Elijah.
